feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 6:17AM AKST until December 23 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. The first band on Friday will start with light, dry, snow tracking northward across the area. The snow will become wetter over the southern panhandle. A break or decrease in snowfall rates will occur before the second frontal

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 1:21PM PST by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 1:39AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: Gusty west to southwest winds will be present in the wind prone corridors early this morning through this afternoon. Wind gusts of 50-55+ MPH will be possible at times, with sustained winds of 25-35 MPH. Those that plan on commuting on Interstate 25 or Interstate 80 in these regions should plan on reducing vehicle speeds due to potential cross winds at times today.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 22 at 10:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rapid ice development on waterways may cause ice jam flooding... With Arctic cold temperatures in the forecast, expect rivers and streams across the area to build ice and freeze up.
